Download and Setup Reptile Database Data

Source: R/data_manage.R
setup_reptile_data.Rd

This function downloads the latest reptile database file, sets it up for use within the package, and applies data cleaning procedures. It handles the download, extraction (if needed), cleaning, and storage of the processed data in the package's data directory.

Usage

setup_reptile_data(
  force_download = FALSE,
  data_dir = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE,
  timeout = 300,
  clean_data = TRUE
)

Arguments

force_download

Logical. If TRUE, forces re-download even if data already exists. Default is FALSE.

data_dir

Character string. Directory where data should be stored. Default is the package's extdata directory.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, prints progress messages. Default is TRUE.

timeout

Numeric. Download timeout in seconds. Default is 300 (5 minutes).

clean_data

Logical. If TRUE, applies data cleaning procedures. Default is TRUE.

Value

Logical. TRUE if download, setup, and cleaning successful, FALSE otherwise.

Details

This function:

  • Downloads the latest reptile database file

  • Extracts ZIP files if necessary

  • Applies data cleaning using clean_reptile_data()

  • Stores both raw and cleaned data in the package directory

  • Creates metadata about the download and processing

  • Sets up the data for immediate use

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Download and setup data with cleaning
setup_reptile_data()

# Force re-download with cleaning
setup_reptile_data(force_download = TRUE)

# Download without cleaning (raw data only)
setup_reptile_data(clean_data = FALSE)
} # }
